title: Get started
text: INSPIRE Directive aims create European Union spatial data infrastructure purposes EU environmental policies policies activities may impact environment. European Spatial Data Infrastructure enable sharing environmental spatial information among public sector organisations, facilitate public access spatial information across Europe assist policy-making across boundaries. https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/-inspire/563 implementation INSPIRE directive Cadastre Navarre allows retrieve spatial objects database cadastre: Vector objects: Parcels, addresses, buildings, cadastral zones . objects provided CatastRoNav sf objects (see ?sf).

title: Get started
text: example retrieve cadastral parcels Olite: plot chunk olite
code: library(CatastRoNav) # For getting coords library(sf) library(mapSpain) # Data wrangling and visualization library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)  olite <- esp_get_capimun(munic = "Olite") %>%   st_transform(25830) %>%   # Small buffer of 100 m   st_buffer(100)   cp <- catrnav_wfs_get_parcels_bbox(olite)   ggplot(cp) +   geom_sf()

title: Get started
text: can create also thematic maps using information available spatial objects. produce visualization urban growth Pamplona using CatastRoNav, replicating map produced Dominic Royé post Visualize urban growth. first place, extract coordinates city center Pamplona using mapSpain: Next step consists extracting buildings using WFS service: Next step creating visualization crop buildings buffer created : plot chunk minimal Let’s extract now construction year, available column beginning: Last step create groups based year create data visualization. use function ggplot2::cut_width() create different classes: plot chunk dataviz
code: # Use mapSpain for getting the coords pamp <- esp_get_capimun(munic = "^Pamplona")  # Transform to ETRS89 / UTM 30 N and add a buffer of 750m  pamp_buff <- pamp %>%   st_transform(25830) %>%   st_buffer(750) pamp_bu <- catrnav_wfs_get_buildings_bbox(pamp_buff) # Cut buildings  dataviz <- st_intersection(pamp_bu, pamp_buff)  ggplot(dataviz) +   geom_sf() # Extract 4 initial positions year <- substr(dataviz$beginning, 1, 4)  # Replace all that doesn't look as a number with 0000 year[!(year %in% 0:2500)] <- "0000"  # To numeric year <- as.integer(year)  # New column dataviz <- dataviz %>%   mutate(year = year) dataviz <- dataviz %>%   mutate(year_cat = ggplot2::cut_width(year,     width = 10   ))   # Adjust the color palette  dataviz_pal <- hcl.colors(   length(levels(dataviz$year_cat)),   "Spectral" )  ggplot(dataviz) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = year_cat), color = NA) +   scale_fill_manual(values = dataviz_pal) +   theme_void() +   labs(title = "PAMPLONA", fill = "") +   theme(     panel.background = element_rect(fill = "black"),     plot.background = element_rect(fill = "black"),     legend.justification = .5,     legend.text = element_text(       colour = "white",       size = 12     ),     plot.title = element_text(       colour = "white", hjust = .5,       margin = margin(t = 30),       size = 30     ),     plot.caption = element_text(       colour = "white",       margin = margin(b = 20), hjust = .5     ),     plot.margin = margin(r = 40, l = 40)   )

title: Get started
text: Royé D (2019). “Visualize urban growth.” https://dominicroye.github.io/en/2019/visualize-urban-growth/.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Diego Hernangómez. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hernangómez D (2023). CatastRoNav: Interface API Catastro de Navarra. doi:10.5281/zenodo.6366407, https://ropenspain.github.io/CatastRoNav/.
code: @Manual{R-catastronav,   title = {{CatastRoNav}: Interface to the {API} Catastro de Navarra},   author = {Diego Hernangómez},   year = {2023},   version = {0.0.2.9000},   doi = {10.5281/zenodo.6366407},   url = {https://ropenspain.github.io/CatastRoNav/},   abstract = {Access public spatial data available under the INSPIRE directive. Tools for downloading references, buildings and addresses of properties on Navarre (Spain).}, }

what: Interface to the INSPIRE services of Catastro de Navarra
title: Interface to the INSPIRE services of Catastro de Navarra
text: CatastRoNav package provide access different API services Cadastre Navarre. CatastRoNav possible download spatial objects buildings cadastral parcels.

title: Interface to the INSPIRE services of Catastro de Navarra
text: can install developing version CatastRoNav using r-universe: Alternatively, can install developing version CatastRoNav :
code: # Enable this universe options(repos = c(   ropenspain = "https://ropenspain.r-universe.dev",   CRAN = "https://cloud.r-project.org" )) install.packages("CatastRoNav") library(remotes) install_github("rOpenSpain/CatastRoNav", dependencies = TRUE)

title: Interface to the INSPIRE services of Catastro de Navarra
text: WFS service allows download vector objects specific cadastral elements. result provided sf objects (See sf package).
code: library(CatastRoNav) library(ggplot2)  wfs_get_buildings <- catrnav_wfs_get_buildings_bbox(   c(-1.652563, 42.478016, -1.646919, 42.483333),   srs = 4326 ) # Map ggplot(wfs_get_buildings) +   geom_sf() +   ggtitle("Olite, Navarra")

title: Interface to the INSPIRE services of Catastro de Navarra

Tools for downloading references, buildings and addresses of properties on Navarre (Spain).}, }

title: Download Addresses of Navarre — catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox
text: Get spatial data addresses bounding box.

title: Download Addresses of Navarre — catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox
text: SITNA – Catastro de Navarra

title: Download Addresses of Navarre — catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox
text: x See Details. : numeric vector length 4 coordinates defines bounding box: c(xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax) sf/sfc object, provided sf package. srs SRS/CRS use query. See Details. verbose Logical, displays information. Useful debugging, default FALSE.

title: Download Addresses of Navarre — catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox
text: sf object.

title: Download Addresses of Navarre — catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox
text: x numeric vector, make sure srs matches coordinate values. Additionally, srs correspond geographic reference system (4326, 4258), function queries bounding box EPSG:25830 - ETRS89 / UTM zone 30N. result provided always SRS provided srs. x sf object, value srs ignored. query performed using EPSG:25830 (ETRS89 / UTM zone 30N) spatial object projected back SRS initial object.

title: Download Addresses of Navarre — catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox
code: # \donttest{ downtown <- c(-1.646812, 42.814528, -1.638036, 42.820320)  ad <- catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox(downtown, srs = 4326) #> Malformed query: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.IOException #> java.io.IOExceptionorg.postgresql.util.PSQLException: An I/O error occurred while sending to the backend. #> An I/O error occurred while sending to the backend. #> Connection reset  library(ggplot2)  ggplot(ad) +   geom_sf()  # }
